meanings.definition: To make Latin in form or character.
meanings.sent1: She latinized the text to make it sound more formal.
meanings.sent2: The professor latinized the document for his research paper.
meanings.sent3: The comedian latinized his jokes to sound like ancient Roman humor.
meanings.sent4: Her music latinized the traditional melodies, giving them a classical twist.
meanings.sent5: The artist latinized the painting, adding Roman elements to the composition.

meanings.sent1: He latinized the Greek text into Latin script for the translation.
meanings.sent2: The scribe latinized the foreign names in the manuscript.
meanings.sent3: The student latinized the Chinese characters into Latin letters for the assignment.
meanings.sent4: The software automatically latinized the non-Latin alphabets for the user.
meanings.sent5: The historian latinized the ancient inscriptions to aid in deciphering the text.

meanings.definition: To give a Latin form or character to.
meanings.sent1: The architect latinized the building's design with Roman columns.
meanings.sent2: The chef latinized the dish by adding traditional Roman spices.
meanings.sent3: The fashion designer latinized the outfit with a toga-inspired drape.
meanings.sent4: The playwright latinized the dialogue to reflect ancient Roman speech patterns.
meanings.sent5: The decorator latinized the room decor with Roman-inspired frescoes.
